job description:
Job Summary
Our Client, a leading chemical company, is seeking an Associate Scientist for the Expression & Technology Development group.
The Associate Scientist will be working under the direction of Scientists and will be responsible for supporting projects related to gene cloning, gene modification, protein expression optimization, strain optimization and associated microbiological support for novel enzyme products.
The successful candidate is expected to complete assigned tasks independently, with minimal supervision.
Work Schedule is Monday through Friday - Typical core hours such as 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM

Responsibilities
High throughput enzyme screening and enzyme activity characterization assays.
Activity and inhibition kinetics analysis, protein quantitation.
Coordinate technical activities with minimal supervision.
Summarize, analyze and interpret moderately complex analytical data.
Achieve successful completion of deliverables with efficiency and adherence to time constraints.

Qualifications
Education/Experience
BS (preferred + 3 years relevant experience) or MS (preferred + 1 year relevant experience or Ph.D with no experience) in Chemical or Biological Engineering, Molecular Biology, Microbiology, Biochemistry, Cellular Biology or related field
Must have experience with aseptic technique and manipulation of microorganisms
Must have experience with PCR, protein gel electrophoresis and other standard molecular biology techniques
Experience with small scale (96-well, 24-well) protein expression, enzymatic assays and DNA/RNA manipulation including extraction/quantitation experience desired
Experience with protein expression and production in bacterial, yeast, or fungal systems is a plus
Experience with protein purification, liquid handling and starch based applications a plus.
Experience with enzyme liquid handling is a plus
Experience with biochemical and enzyme assays and analysis. Experience with HPLC, SDS-PAGE and analysis.

Skills
Excellent attention to detail, organization, communication and time management skills
Must be highly self-motivated and enjoy working in a team-oriented environment
Ability to work in a multidisciplinary and fast paced environment, both independently and in a team setting.

Please submit your resume for consideration. Once submitted, feel free to contact Sanka at 646-856-8903 for additional information.

Approx. Duration: 6 months
